items.title: Founding Member for operations – Clinical Artificial Intelligence Start-Up
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=24, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Founding Member for operations – Clinical Artificial Intelligence Start-Up


 


Summary


 


Most of the clinical AI solutions in the market have got general practice focus and therefore do not provide the cancer-specific outcome. Given the COVID 19 Pandemic, bringing the whole world to a lockdown, institutions worldwide are looking to adopt artificial intelligence to overcome the manual clinical workflow in community and cancer care. We want to move from technology readiness level (TRL) 4 to 5/6 and due to coronavirus lockdown, we are looking for somebody who is in the UK mainland and will be able to be a part of our thriving team supporting operation, market analysis and investor relationships. In an industry which is predicted and known in the past to grow at 50% CAGR, this role will provide an excellent opportunity for anyone who wants their flying career. We are a month to two away from our launch and therefore it is ideal time for a founding member to join us and take a leading role in carrying out operations and investor relationships.


 


Our goal


 


Our goal is to reduce disparities in cancer care by using next-generation technologies such as artificial intelligence and next-generation genomic sequencing. We use patient data collected for clinical purposes to answer various types of clinical questions for patient care.


 


Responsibilities


 


The primary responsibilities will include



  1. Maintaining relationship with investors

  2. Exploring the market landscape for our clinical AI product is one of essential component of this role. should have the sales skills to be able to lease with NHS systems clinicians and GPs and healthcare networks.

  3. Accelerate adoption of our products at hospital communities NHS and healthcare organizations.


 


Qualifications


 


Start-up mindset - it is important for the applicant to be resilient and passionate in overcoming the challenges and lead initiative in business development. It is therefore important that the applicant is proactive, driven and determined.


 


Background and exposure in healthcare is mandatory. However, those who are generalists who have a desire to be specialists in healthcare are also welcome to apply.


The applicant can be of one of the categories



  • MBA from a reputed institution.

  • Past proven track record of sales, business building, operation and marketing is desirable.

  • Anyone who is a serial entrepreneur or played a co-founder role in a previous company.


 


Strong IT skills, familiarity with the web technologies, general marketing skills such as business communication, fundraising is a desirable part of this role.


 


The applicant will be required to cross over and help other teams when required from time to time.


 


Time Commitment + Location



  • Time-commitment - Variable as needed till the phase of seed-funding and then continuous steering of the company activities to ensure we sustain the growth trajectory and reach the milestones in time.

  • UK location preferable.

  • Virtual remote working during COVID lockdown is a possibility


Remuneration



  • Delayed compensation plan till seed funding.

  • Salary + Equity - Negotiable, Top of Industry Standards of Payment, Subject to Performance and Past Experience.


Why Join YouDiagnose? 


https://youtu.be/CQSxmFcLQfo 


 


Advantages of Joining YouDiagnose


 



  • Opportunity to learn and grow in the area of clinical informatics, clinical AI and clinical ML

  • Provides a unique opportunity to play a leadership role in healthcare transformation of the country and of the whole world.

  • Hughes leadership opportunity for candidates who show passion, commitment and integrity


Website - https://www.youdiagnose.online/ 


 



  • * Sound interesting? if you think you have the best composition of the above, send us your Cv and let's chat!

items.title: Remote Greeter/Proctor, Temporary
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=32}
items.content:
Description

We are the world’s learning company with more than 24,000 employees operating in 70 countries. We combine world-class educational content and assessment,powered by services and technology, to enable more effective teaching and personalized learning at scale. We believe that wherever learning flourishes so do people.

TheOnVUEGreeter and Proctorroles areresponsible forthe check- in and live monitoring of candidates who are testing remotely via Pearson VUE’s Online Proctored (OnVUE) delivery mode.Pearson VUE relies heavily upon both rolesto ensure the security and integrity of exams, and to provide a smooth and positive candidatetestingexperience.

The primary responsibility of greeters isto check candidates in for testing; check-in steps include verifying candidate identify via ID checkand reviewing the candidate’s testing environment to ensure security compliance.Most interactions can occur via chat, but phone contacts are also available if the greeter has a mic and/or headset.Greeters also aid and provide an escalation pathto Pearson VUE support teamswhen issues arise during the check-in process.

The primary responsibility of proctors is toensure a secure testing process for the duration of the exam. Proctors intervene if a candidate breaks key rules(provided to them ahead of testing)that put either exam content or the integrity of testing at risk; theserulesinclude use of a mobile phone or paper/pencil, leaving the room while testing,and allowing a third party to enter the room. Proctors also aid and provide an escalation pathto Pearson VUE support teamswhen issues arise during testing.Most interactions can occur via chat, but phone contacts are also available if the proctor has a mic and/or headset.

Qualifications

Successfulcandidates will have excellent communication skills,greatattention to detail and astrong customer service focus.

*Assignment details*

This is a temporary assignment scheduled to start within the next 2 weeks.It’s estimated to runapproximatelythroughearly June, although the end date may fluctuate based on changes in workload.

Work schedule:Work schedules would be determined based onyour availability responses as well as theavailable testingschedules.

Work location: This is a remote position. All work will be performed from home using your own equipment.

Pearson is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and a member of E-Verify. All qualified applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities are encouraged to apply.

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=96, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=4, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=10}
items.content:
Healthcare
Patient Support Calls

Medical Experience Preferred


Job ID# A2002

 

Leverage your customer service expertise and Medical knowledge to provide the latest in TeleHealth Solutions by helping to enroll patients in an online and on demand healthcare delivery service that's transforming the world of medicine, all from the comfort of your own home! 

 

About Parkes & Co.

 

Parkes & Co. connects small call center companies, run by people like you, to prestigious Fortune 500 clients through a virtual platform. Parkes & Co. provides the clients, you provide the service. YOU have the power to choose your clients, and schedule from the comfort of your own home. You have the opportunity to live your work from home dream. When you own your own business, you’re the boss.

 

WHAT TO EXPECT:

 

What’s Needed to Provide Customer Support for this Client

- Assisting callers with enrollment inquiries
- Determining offerings customers are missing
- Explain offered services and benefits


WHAT IT TAKES TO SUCCEED:


Must-Have Qualities and Capabilities

- Familiarity with medical terms and healthcare industry

- Familiarity with company processes and policies
- Clear, confident and professional communication skills to build trust and rapport
- Understanding of “patient call flow”
- Quick-thinking management of patient needs
- Assertiveness to promote additional products and services
- Empathy and a sincere desire to assist and prioritize the patient
- Tenacity to understand and deliver on patients’ needs

 

EDUCATION NECESSARY:


No degrees necessary - great work from home opportunity for anyone who is ready to start a business and be their own

boss.


WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING:


Providing great inbound, patient inquiry and enrollment service calls.


WHAT YOU NEED TO GET STARTED:


- Apply

- A Computer

- High Speed wired Internet  (No WiFi)

- Phone with headset

- Pass a background screening

This is not an offer of employment. It is an opportunity to enter into a business-to-business relationship with

Parkes & Co..


Requirements

Background Screening

• Have no felonies or fraudulent behaviors.

PC Requirements

• A desktop/tower computer with a separate monitor is recommended.
• Dual boot machines, Netbooks, and Tablets are prohibited from use.
• All-in-One computers are not currently compatible with any client programs.


  • CPU Speed
    • Dual-core 2.8 GHz or better or
    • Intel i class or AMD Phenom X2 class or better
    • Atom, Celeron, Pentium and Opteron processors are notpermitted
  • Hard Drive 20 GB or more of available space
    • 60 GB or more of total space
  • Memory 4 GB of RAM or better
  • Operating System Windows 7 or Windows 10
    • Windows 8/8.1 not supported by some clients
  • Standard Connection and Speed Hard-wired connection (no wireless)
    • Minimum 10 mbps download / Minimum 3 mbps upload
    • Maximum Latency Threshold 120 milliseconds (ms)
  • Monitor Recommendations
    • 1280 x 1024 (SXGA) screen resolution
    • 1920 x 1080 (Full HD or 1080p)
    • Dual monitors may be required on some client programs

Mac Requirements

• Macs must have an Ethernet port
• MacBook Air and Mac USB-C ports will not be supported
• Boot Camp and a licensed version of Windows (please see page 2 for acceptable Windows
operating systems) MUST be installed.

Accessories, Software and Internet/Phone Service Providers

REQUIRED ACCESSORIES

  • USB headset with microphone (required for Certification)
    • Logitech, Plantronics, Microsoft, or similar brands recommended.
                  Suggestions:
                  • Plantronics PLNAUDIO478 USB
                  • Logitech USB H570e
                  • Jabra UC VOICE 150
  • Hard-wired Telephone and headset (required for Production/Servicing)
    • Plantronics S12 or similar recommended

SOFTWARE

Internet Explorer 8, 9, 10, or 11 on
Windows 7, 8 or 10
Certain client programs may require specific versions of
Windows. Windows 8/8.1 not supported by some clients.
(Optional) Mozilla Firefox or Chrome for Windows
Microsoft Security Essentials for
Windows 7; Windows Defender for
Windows 8 or 10

Other security software may be incompatible and should be
avoided. Technical support may be refused if your company’s
software configuration is not compatible with the Arise
Platform or is determined to cause incompatibilities with client
required servicing software.

INTERNET AND PHONE SERVICE PROVIDERS

Hard-wired broadband Internet service via DSL, Cable, or Fiber Optic connection

The use of wireless connections to access any system at any time is prohibited, even if the connection is encrypted.
Connectivity to the Platform through an unauthorized Proxy Service or unauthorized VPN Service is strictly prohibited.
Additionally, Satellite, Microwave, and Cellular Hotspot Internet Services are not permitted.
USB connected modems are not supported.

Hard-wired land line telephone service

Unless stated otherwise in the opportunity announcement, most client programs are compatible with the following types
of services: POTS (plain old telephone service), cable telephony, digital service, or business class VoIP.
The service should be connected directly from the wall to your telephone.
Soft phones and cell phones are not permitted.
The servicing telephone line should not interface at any point with the computer.
All servicing telephone lines should not have voicemail, fax, or other features on the line (other than unlimited long
distance, if necessary – please see page 7 for details).

Call centers and agents have the option to use either a POTS line (plain old telephone service) or VoIP (aka digital telephone or cable telephony) to service a client program. However, call centers and agents servicing client programs that route calls through the AVG system will need to be able to dial into the AVG (786) number.
      • Call Centers and agents who do not have Miami area code phone numbers (305 or 786) will need to be able to dial long distance on their       service lines which may result in long distance charges. For that reason, bulk or unlimited long-distance service plans are recommended and       available from most carriers to avoid per-minute charges.
      • A small number of client programs currently prohibit the use of VoIP while servicing and a POTS line will be required to service those programs.       If the client program does not currently allow VoIP, agents will not be servicing on AVG.

Please be sure to review the opportunity announcement in detail to see if AVG is required on the client program you select.


Benefits

  • Work from home
  • Determine your own work schedule
  • Scalable income opportunity

items.title: Wanted: Military Historian Podcast Host
items.content:
Wanted: Military Historian Podcast Host

Company: Ammo.com
Location: Anywhere
Job Type: Contract
Description

Hi ProBloggers,

Looking for an American podcast host who is knowledgeable about the following areas:

  • Military history
  • Prepping and survivalism i.e. TEOTWAWKI
  • Firearms history
  • American history
  • Ethics and philosophy
  • Constitutional law
  • Ron Paul's presidential campaigns

Skill-wise, we're looking for:

  • Affable personality
  • Confident on-air (radio experience is a plus)
  • An experienced host and interviewer
  • An engaging storyteller
  • Tech-savvy enough to record podcasts
  • A reliable, quiet place to record at with good wi-fi

In the past we've had good luck hiring writers here at ProBlogger.

Although we're not hiring another writer at the moment, perhaps you - or someone you know - could host a weekly podcast for us?

We already have the format, editing team, and distribution lined up for our podcast.  What we need now is a solid, reliable host who gets along with our existing on-air talent to make our show engaging and insightful.

This is an ongoing job to host a weekly podcast which helps raise awareness of our brand and brand's mission.

Application Instructions
Please send the following in your application:

1. Two audio samples of you as a guest/host/etc.

2. Three books every American should read, and why.

3. The number 333.

4. What podcast(s) you currently listen to, and why.

5. What time zone you're in

6. What your recording studio is like.

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=8, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content:
Remote | High-paying
  • US – DISTRIBUTED
  • ADMIN

At Fishtown Analytics, our mission is to empower analysts to create and disseminate organizational knowledge. The open source product we maintain, dbt (https://getdbt.com), is used by thousands of companies every week, and that number is growing fast.

We’re looking for an experienced accounting and finance professional to come in and grow our finance function. You would be the first person in this area of the business, and we’d want you to wear multiple hats: accounting, financial planning, board reporting, etc. At first, we need you to roll up your sleeves and get things done, but as the company grows we’ll want you to help us grow the finance function into a best-in-class team.

Who we are

At Fishtown Analytics, we have developed strong opinions on how companies should practice analytics.

Specifically, we believe that:

  • Code, not graphical user interfaces, is the best abstraction to express complex analytic logic
  • Data analysts should adopt similar practices and tools to software developers
  • Critical analytics infrastructure should be controlled by its users as open source software
  • Analytic code itself—not just analytics tools—will increasingly be open source

It turns out that a lot of other people believe this too! Over the course of the past several years we’ve built a community of 5,000+ people and 1,700 companies who are using our ideas, products, and workflows to conduct analytics, including Lyft, Monzo, GitLab, Snowflake, the ACLU, Amazon, JetBlue, and RentTheRunway. Our product, dbt, has come to be synonymous with the practice of analytics engineering, defining an entire industry.

We’re on a mission to empower analysts to create and disseminate organizational knowledge. If this sounds like a mission you could get behind, we’re excited to get your help to continue to power this growth into the future.

Who we’re looking for:

An experiencedaccounting professional with experience at a venture-backed startup (SaaS is a plus!). You’ll be responsible for the entire finance and accounting function and will be reporting directly to the CEO. We’ll be relying on you to define accounting best practices and processes, handle financial and board report reporting, work with members of the executive team to create and track budgets and forecasts, implement billing systems, and so much more. Our business is at an inflection point right now and you’ll have the opportunity to design our Finance function from the ground up.

In this role, you can expect to:

  • Manage accounting operations, monthly/quarterly accounting close and preparation of financial statements.
  • Ensure consistent compliance of corporate accounting principles and procedures in full compliance with US GAAP reporting standards.
  • Review current automated billing processes and implement changes and/or new systems as appropriate.
  • Work with external accounting resources to prepare tax filings.
  • Partner effectively with non-accounting functions to create and report against departmental budgets.
  • Partner with the CEO to create and maintain a forward-looking plan for the business.
  • Partner with internal analytics resources to create reporting for internal stakeholders that is accurate and useful.
  • Build and manage a team of remote employees.

You are a good fit if you:

  • Have 5+ years of in-house accounting experience. Experience in venture-backed companies is a must. Experience in a SaaS environment is a plus.
  • Have a CPA or a graduate degree in accounting.
  • Have led teams before; have both hired and fired. Leading remote teams is a plus, but not required.
  • Have the interest and desire to grow—this role will have you take on new functional and leadership challenges!
  • Ability to make decisions, prioritize effectively and meet deadlines while maintaining the highest level of standards for completeness and accuracy.
  • Have executive presence with excellent written and oral communication skills.
  • Demonstrated ability to work cross-culturally and to succeed in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
  • Share our values, and work in accordance with those values.

Compensation

  • Salary: $110k – $160k
  • Benefits: Unlimited vacation, 401k w/ 3% guaranteed contribution, health/vision/dental insurance, and paid parental leave

A Final Note!

At Fishtown Analytics, we are committed to hiring and cultivating a diverse team. If you are on the fence about whether you meet our requirements, please apply anyway!

Fishtown Analytics is headquartered in Philadelphia, PA. While about half of our team is based on-site, we have a quickly-growing number of distributed team members and are a first-class distributed team. We welcome candidates to this role anywhere in the continental United States.

Apply for job

What is NALA?At NALA, we’re on a mission to build a bank Africa loves to use. We are always keen to hear from capable, creative engineers who want to help us accomplish that goal. Customers currently use our app to make payments (in Tanzania and Uganda) 7x faster all without using the internet and across multiple accounts. We’re a small team based in Tanzania, Uganda and Egypt and growing our business and engineering functions. We graduated from Y Combinator a year ago and raised a new round of funding. Find us on TechCrunch, Fast Company and our blog.

Backed by: Y Combinator, Accel Partners (their first African Investment!), DST Global, DFS Lab, NYCA Partners, and several incredible fintech angel investors.

Who are we looking for? We are open to remote preferably in GMT to +3GMT timezones. We are looking for an experienced Android engineer who has an exceptional background in programming and software architecture--someone who is ready to dive into our Android codebase and build the best financial app for Africa.The ideal candidate is a lover of fintech, a quick learner, strong problem solver, and is not afraid to step out of his or her comfort zone to learn and try new technologies and strategies. The candidate will be expected to dive into the technical details of the product, contribute to NALA’s technical vision, and help recruit NALA’s growing engineering team. The ideal candidate will have had experience working in a fast-moving startup environment, and should be excited about the tough technical challenges we face.

items.title: It's especially important now that companies tell us about their process so that we can compare ...
items.content:
It's especially important now that companies tell us about their process so that we can compare and expedite, including how many:

- technical phone screens

- video interviews / coding interviews

- projects (esp. length and duration, paid/unpaid, etc)

- portfolio / code reviews on past projects

- onsite interviews and if there's any whiteboarding or pairing, etc. [note: we'll assume these are virtual now]

- will the position stay remote or do you plan on making it in-person?

As well as the total amount of time you expect interviewing to take!

Thanks :)

items.content:
Pachyderm (YC W15) -- REMOTE (within North America) or San Francisco -- https://jobs.lever.co/pachyderm/

Positions:

* Core distributed systems/infrastructure engineer (Golang)- You’ll be solving hard algorithmic and distributed systems problems every day and building a first-of-its-kind, containerized, data infrastructure platform.

* Senior Front-end Engineer (React,Javascript) - Your work will be focused on developing our enterprise UI, perfecting the user experience, and pioneering new products such as a hosted version of Pachyderm's data solution.

* DevOps -- Pachyderm is hiring a deployment and DevOps expert Experience with Kubernetes, CI/CD systems, testing infra, and running large-scale, data-heavy applications is important as well at least a little Golang development experience.

* Solutions Engineer/Architect -- Work with Pachyderm’s OSS and Enterprise customers to ensure their success. This is a customer facing role that bridges support, product, customer success, and engineering.

About Pachyderm:

Love Docker, Golang, Kubernetes and distributed systems? Pachyderm is an enterprise data science platform that offers Git-like version control semantics for massive data sets and end-to-end data lineage tracking and auditing. Teams that find themselves struggling to maintain a growing mess of advance data science tasks such as machine learning or bioinformatics/genomics research use Pachyderm to greatly simplify their system and reduce development time. They rely on Pachyderm to do the heavy lifting so they can focus on the business logic in their data pipelines.

%% How has COVID-19 effected Pachyderm? %%

We're in the fortunate position that our business has been minimally effected by covid. We have 3+ years of runway and were already a remote-friendly team, so this transition to full-remote has only been a minor change. We sell to fortune 2000 enterprise companies so while our sales cycles have gotten more complicated and slowed slightly during this chaos, our overall sales funnel and business is still very healthy.

Check us out at:

pachyderm.com

http://github.com/pachyderm/pachyderm

3) Web app testing/QA work on a sporadic but pretty frequent basis.

Reach me at my-handle@gmail.com

items.content:
Microsoft Healthcare: EmpowerMD | Full-time | Seattle/Redmond, WA, USA | Onsite

Imagine a visit to the doctor’s office where the focus is on you. Not the computer. We’re EmpowerMD in Microsoft Healthcare (https://aka.ms/empowermd), and we’re building an ambient intelligence for the clinic you can see in our 2 minute demo video (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=jnGlOCBK3kM).

Last October, we announced a partnership with Nuance Communications to create the exam room of the future (https://news.microsoft.com/2019/10/17/nuance-and-microsoft-p...)

If you’re mission driven, want to work on a collaborative multi-disciplinary team to build AI for good, we’d like to chat with you. We’re actively hiring engineers with full-stack engineering experience on a modern stack (React, NodeJS, serverless, K8S, NoSQL, etc.)

- Senior Software Engineer: https://aka.ms/empowermd-sde-sr

- Software Engineer II: https://aka.ms/empowermd-sde-ii

All positions are Redmond, WA only and international relocation is not available at this time. We are currently working remotely from home due to COVID-19 but we are looking to hire full-time employees now who can work with us in Redmond, WA when we are able to return to work at the Microsoft main campus. We cannot support long-term remote work because of our partner's privacy/security requirements.

If you’re interested, please email (with an updated CV): ask-empowermd@microsoft.com

items.title: Principle Lifecycle Assessment Consultant
tags: DBG:surround``3N( OR(feasibl,OR(consid,consider),option,occas,opportun,possibl,abil), OR(3N(remot, work),telecommut,2N(work,home)) ) NOT OR(regularli, abracadabra)
items.content:
Mondra is a well-funded, early stage tech start up that intends to transform the food system. Our vision is to drive standardisation across the agri-food sector for measuring sustainability and deliver a world first self-service LCA and sustainability improvements platform.


 


We are looking for a Principal Lifecycle Assessment (LCA) Consultant to come and join our ambitious team in London. You’ll be leading on LCA projects for existing and new clients whilst supporting the research and development of the Mondra platform. The ideal consultant will be someone who recognises the potential of Mondra and will be an evangelist for the way we do things. If you’re excited by the prospect of utilising your knowledge to help shape our platform and not just be delivering reports every day, then this opportunity could be ideal for you.


 


About Mondra


Mondra’s platform allows food producers to monitor, improve and communicate their sustainability outcomes to the market. We are well supported by a large consortium of major players across private/public sector and academia. 


 


Key Responsibilities:



  • Performing complex LCAs in the context of wide-ranging projects

  • Performing detailed calculations to determine material flows, greenhouse gas emissions, ecological footprints and other environmental metrics as may be required.

  • Project management including client liaison, workstream planning and execution, progress reporting

  • Execution of client deliverables including LCA report writing

  • Mentoring and training a growing team of LCA consultants

  • Technical research and results dissemination

  • Supporting engineering team to impart domain knowledge, contribute to platform R&D efforts and be the LCA subject matter expert in all engineering related matters

  • Supporting business development, including client meetings and proposals


 


Person Specification & Experience:



  • 1st Class or 2:1 STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, Maths) BA/MA Degree

  • Excellent analytical skills applying various LCA methods

  • Solid experience delivering complex LCAs within different markets with demonstratable food industry experience

  • Exceptional client facing and consulting skills

  • Self-motivated with strong communication skills

  • Ability to respond positively to pressure and take a flexible approach to a dynamic, fast moving and changing work environment

  • An over-arching mindset of achieving shared objectives as a team

  • A strong ability to lead and influence at all levels, both internally and externally

  • An entrepreneurial mindset, with the ability to think on your feet

  • Comfortable in a culture where structure is not necessarily easy to provide; revel in change and look for opportunities to take ownership


Package


Competitive remuneration model, work from home options, company benefits.

items.title: Production Coordinator
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
Do you have great organisational skills, a keen eye for detail, are resourceful, good with people and have the ability to handle a variety of tasks in high-pressure situations?


Do you have a passion for creativity with a strong affinity with video and a spirited desire to push yourself and the boundaries of what you can achieve?


Yes? Then keep reading.


Who are VidOps?


VidOps are visual storytellers and expert video-creators. We manage all aspects of the production lifecycle from pre-production through to production and shooting footage, post-production edits and final delivery of media content, along with our community of creative talent. 


We designed the business this way so our clients can focus on their daily operations without worrying about their internal media production projects – whilst being supported with planning, updated on project progress and have their edited content delivered online.


We are a London-based startup currently working towards our series A investment round – focusing on improving our current service offering and also developing a web application which will support all areas of the business. We are a small multi-functional team, wearing multiple hats, working hard and enjoying ourselves along the way. 


What you will be doing


As we begin to expand we are looking for our first Production Coordinator to work with our creative community to create amazing visual media content for our customers.



  1. Manage the production of a number of visual media projects at any time spanning from shoot planning, coordinating crew, post-production, logistics planning, and budgeting

  2. Being both creatively confident and organised, providing creative direction of projects delivering quality content whilst ensuring our customers are supported and all logistics are managed seamlessly

  3. Provide account management and excellent customer service to our clients always keeping communication lines open and being a main point of contact

  4. Facilitate communication between customers and creators to ensure smooth project delivery

  5. Administrative skills - you’ll be manning operations on our new custom video production platform via our instant chat, answering inbound queries and providing project quotes for our customers


Who you are



  1. You ideally have a background in film or creative production and are interested in video 

  2. You have a strong sense of urgency and exceptional organisational skills

  3. You have the ability to remain calm and level-headed under pressure and are a reliable team player

  4. A plus would be a background in video production management--managing multiple projects end-to end and juggling budgets, resources, schedules, clients

  5. You enjoy and embrace technology, VidOps is a media/tech startup after all

  6. You can quickly immerse yourself in startup culture--can quickly adapt to change at a high speed pace

  7. You are confident, proactive, full of perseverance and ambition with absolutely no ego

  8. Exceptional written, verbal, and interpersonal communicator, as building authentic relationships with customers

  9. You are an analytical and strategic thinker, with a logical approach to problem-solving


Why join the team?


At VidOps, you’ll be working in a fast-paced, highly-collaborative environment as a core part of a small, focused, multidisciplinary Commercial team. You’ll be working directly with our Operations lead.


It’s an exciting opportunity for the right person to learn a lot and progress quickly, with lots of freedom and challenges that come with an entrepreneurial, early stage startup at the beginnings of growth. If you want an opportunity to be a core part in moulding the future of the department and company, then this is the role for you!


There’s lots of social activities, company nights out and a free fully stocked fridge with plenty of beer, milk (cow and oat!), juice and coffee machine, not to mention our communal office has a ping-pong table and pool table, onsite cafe, showers and is just off Notting Hill’s famous Portobello Road.


Role Requirements


Essential:



  1. 1+ years experience in customer facing role

  2. Keen to further progress a production career in a fast-paced, high-growth commercial environment

  3. Confident communicator, both in person and online

  4. Demonstrable experience of building strong professional relationships

  5. Proactive with the ability to multitask and prioritise

  6. Creative and solutions oriented

  7. Willingness to work flexibly and wear multiple hats in a fast-growing business environment


Desired:



  1. Experience in creative production.

  2. Adobe Creative Suite.

  3. Knowledge of video production


Compensation



  1. Base salary £25,000.00

  2. Bonus incentive


    1. Departmental Bonus

    2. Company performance Bonus


  3. Equity through EMI share option scheme 0.33%


Benefits



  1. High-growth, entrepreneurial environment

  2. Exposure to all areas of the business, with opportunity to undertake business-wide projects

  3. Career progression with associated pay increases and opportunities to be on the employee share scheme

  4. 28 days holiday including bank holidays

  5. Working remotely/flexible working

  6. Open plan London office, with snacks and a beer fridge

  7. Team building activities every 2 weeks

items.title: Technical Product Lead - Medical Software

DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=5, c=10, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=2, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=2}
items.content:
Location: London or Cambridge UK


Employment Type: Full Time


Reporting to: CTO


At Motilent, we are on a mission to change how we see the gut. Founded in 2014, we use the latest in medical imaging science to create tools for clinicians that lead to better patient outcomes in chronic gut conditions such as Crohn’s disease. We follow an audited ISO 13485 Quality Management System.


Having secured further funding, we are seeking to further grow our tech team with passionate and self-motivated individuals who have experience working within or leading commercially-driven teams.


As a successful applicant you will have the opportunity to work alongside world-leading experts to define and develop a new cutting-edge clinical product which will impact on patient care both within the NHS as well as globally. As the technical owner of this product, you will, (with the support of a project manager), need to define a robust architecture and tech stack, while understanding deeply the needs and requirements of the end users in the clinic. You will need to carefully identify product milestones and engineering resources required to achieve them. Once resources are committed to your milestones, you will oversee progress, delivery and product releases.


Responsibilities



  • Ability to work from a clean slate on a new clinical product with domestic & global impact to improve patient outcomes.

  • Define and communicate a robust architecture and tech stack.

  • Ownership of all technical decisions relating to the product.

  • Close working relationship with regulatory, science and clinical experts.

  • Definition, risk assessment and prioritization of all tehnical work in the product.

  • Product software development including analysis, architecture and design, development, testing and all associated documentation

  • Caring that the code quality of the software system implementation is aligned with Motilent coding standards and practices

  • Research, investigation and prototyping of new technologies

  • Collaborating with other team members including regular communication of progress of tasks

  • Eager and self-motivated to learn and assist others in improving how we develop software

  • Support and maintenance activities for software issues

  • Pursue learning and self-development and sharing of knowledge with others


Prior experience: >5 years as a (senior) engineer within a commercial enterprise with evidence of keen problem-solving skills and able to use initiative to solve technical challenges


Academic background: degree in a numerate discipline with a sound mathematical base. (or equivalent courses)


Coding skills: Expert working knowledge of at least {C#, Java or C++} working knowledge of at least 1 other higher level language {e.g. python, typescript, javascript}


Areas of commercial expertise (at least 2 of): web services, image processing algorithms, DICOM, medical imaging, cloud computing, web based UI frameworks, UI design patterns and architecture for highly interactive applications, performance code


Project management: Ideally worked under a formal quality system, able to take user needs and drill down into detailed, risk-assessed, technical specifications, verification and validation activities. Assemble work into coherent milestones. Proven ability to work to deadlines individually and as part of a team


Leadership experience: Ideally led or managed software engineers on commercial projects.


Benefits



  • Work with world leading clinical experts in the gastrointestinal field

  • Have your software delpoyed to clinical instiutions in the UK helping patients manage their conditions

  • Engineer robust, high quality software. With the time to do things property.

  • 35h working week

  • Pension scheme

  • Competitive salary

  • 25d paid holiday + bank holidays

  • Remote working options within the UK

  • Share option sheme

  • Budget and time for learning on the job

  • Your choice of company laptop


What is Motilent’s company culture?


Motilent aims to deliver quantitative tools into day-to-day clincial practice for GI diagnosis and treatment response. We achieve this through close cooperation with: clincial experts and institutions throughout the world,transitioning cutting-edge science into robust, reliable clinical products, recruiting engineers and specialists that want to make an impact in the medical space, be proud of their work and the benefit it has to the UK and beyond. We want to get the most of your expertise during working hours by providing a challenging and worthwhile investment of your time. We will provide opportunities to take new responsibility and learn with us as we grow. We are a small company, your voice will be heard and your talents and efforts make a direct impact on company success with the concomitant financial rewards. We want to offer a place where, in a few years, you can say I learned, I took responisibility, we did that, it’s cool and worthwhile.


NOTE: No Recuiters or Agencies Please!

items.title: COO
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=4, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=5}
items.content:
About the start-up:


We all know dating can get a bit frosty, a study as shown, for long term relationships people get along with people who share similar interests and most people get nervous about a date for lack of conversation.


We have solved this issue! Introducing Brezaa, Brezaa, is smart intelligence interests focused relationship app for IPhone and Android, which aims to make meeting people less awkward and more fun, through true or false personalised icebreakers and interests matching with smart intelligence algorithms.


This gives users the Instagram sticky feature, users check back on Brezaa to see who has guessed their ice breakers, and users see exactly how they match with each other based on their choices at sign up, which we receive amazing five-star reviews on the app stores.


Where we’re at:



  • App available on IOS and Android

  • Almost 10k users

  • £30,00 invested from founder

  • Owning the rights to the technology

  • Trademarked brand logo UK, USA, Europe

  • Partnership arranged with music artist who has 2.5 million followers

  • Media Coverage 

  • Building more partnerships

  • Promotional video created for investors and crowdfunding

  • Preparing to reach out to investors for scaling

  • Investor pitch deck ready

  • Financial forecasts ready

  • Business plan ready


Who are we:



  • We are a company who believes great is not good enough. We have a team who works exceptionally well and share the same business vision. We also believe “clear concise communication creates clarity and saves time”.


Who you are / Role requirements:



  • Set comprehensive goals for performance and growth

  • Assist with the business strategies, plans and procedures

  • Establish policies that promote company culture and vision

  • Oversee daily operations of the company and the work of executives (IT, Marketing, Sales, Finance etc.)

  • Lead employees to encourage maximum performance and dedication

  • Evaluate performance by analyzing and interpreting data and metrics

  • Write and submit reports to the CEO in all matters of importance

  • Assist CEO in fundraising ventures

  • Participate in expansion activities (investments, acquisitions, corporate alliances etc.)

  • Manage relationships with partners/vendors


Requirements



  • Proven experience as Chief Operating Office or relevant role

  • You are flexible and keen to learn

  • You are happy to roll your sleeves up and get stuck into an early-stage startup

  • Understanding of business functions such as HR, Finance, marketing etc.

  • Demonstrable competency in strategic planning and business development

  • Experience in fundraising will be a plus

  • Working knowledge of data analysis and performance/operation metrics

  • Working knowledge of IT/Business infrastructure and MS Office

  • Outstanding organizational and leadership abilities

  • Excellent interpersonal and public speaking skills

  • Aptitude in decision-making and problem-solving

  • Interviewing and setting salaries as the team grows

  • Degree in Business Administration or relevant field; is a plus


You are excited to be part of a small startup co-founding team, but also motivated by personal ambition. You are flexible and learn quickly. As a COO, you will have tremendous ownership and responsibility for a big aspect of the business. And will eventually be the lead in developing the team. Communication will be key since we will be mainly working remotely, and meet every two weeks until we get funding.


The team is laid-back, yet focused on scaling the business to reach a mass market. You want to grow with a start-up that’s already gained traction, proven concept and moving in the right direction. You will have an interest in a start-up culture and believe in their vision as well.


Salary is not possible at the moment as we have just started to reach out to investors as we will be crowdfunding for our first fundraiser, only then the salary will be available. So, for now, it's joining our team and not quitting your current job just yet if you have one. :)


Part-time to start! Full time after investment!

items.title: Probate Solicitor
items.content:
We’re looking for a Probate specialist case handler / probate solicitor to join our growing legal team at Farewill. 


 


This role is a unique opportunity to help us shape and grow our probate business.


 


In the next 12 months you will:



  • Work closely with our probate lead solicitor to help us shape, deliver and grow our probate business.

  • Help run a mixed caseload of simple and complex applications for grants of representation for non-taxable and taxable cases.

  • Help build and supervise the team around you in order to deliver on our ambitious goals.

  • Help drive and improve the quality and consistency of our probate customer experience.

  • Play an integral role in achieving our mission to change the way the world deals with death.


 


Hopefully, you’ll have some or all of the following:



  • You have proven experience of probate and estate administration in a volume environment.

  • You are customer-focused. At Farewill, customers come first. You need to be enthusiastic about our customers.

  • You have a great eye for detail and the ability to communicate complex legal problems simply.

  • You enjoy working in a fast-paced environment, being hands-on and getting things done.

  • You are excited by technology and the opportunity to step away from traditional ways, assumptions and perceived wisdom.


 


Some extra skills that would be great:



  • Qualified solicitor, but it’s not essential. Experience is more relevant than qualification for this role.

  • Experience supervising a team.


 


If this sounds like what you’d love to be doing, we can’t wait to hear from you. If you’re not sure that you exactly fit the above criteria, get in touch anyway. Personality and attitude is just as important as experience!


 


What we offer in return:



  • Competitive salary and generous stock options



  • 28 days of annual leave plus the usual public holidays

  • Flexible start and end to your day

  • Lovely, spacious, bright office in Haggerston. But, if London’s not for you, that’s ok - we can make remote working work for the right candidate too.

  • Regular off-site days and team lunches

  • Santander cycles membership! 

  • A chance to make a meaningful contribution to people's lives and deaths

  • And much more!


 


About Farewill:

At Farewill, we’re out to change the way the world deals with death. Helping people to take control, personally and financially, of what matters to them after they’re gone.


 


We launched our first product - our will-writing service - in December 2016, and since then we’ve grown to be the largest will-writer in the UK. We launched our second product, Probate, in early 2019, and recently our third, Cremation.


 


Our growth to date has been driven by an exceptional product (see our customer reviews) and key strategic partnerships. We’ve been featured in Forbes, The Times, The Guardian and on Radio 4 among others. We're also making waves in the charity world - with over £100 million raised for charities on our platform from gifts left in wills. 


 


Our team:

We’re a creative, focused team who love what we do. We have backgrounds in design, technology, behavioural psychology, and management consultancy. We love to learn from each other and our customers, and grow together as a team.



Based in our lovely office in Haggerston, we’re backed by some of the best investors in Europe - from the founders of Transferwise and Zoopla, to Kindred Capital, SAATCHiNVEST, JamJar and DMGT.

This is an unusual, fascinating, and emotional area to work in – if you’re up for a big challenge we’d love to meet you.


 


If you’d like to understand our culture and product better, here’s a few articles for you to read: About Farewill, Life at Farewill, Are you worried about your will? 





If this sounds like what you’d love to be doing, we can’t wait to hear from you. If you’re not sure that you exactly fit the above criteria, get in touch anyway. Personality and attitude is just as important as experience!

items.title: Developpeur Senior
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=12, other=0, dotnet=0, c=5, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=24, frontend=1}
items.content:
Labellevie by Deleev

 

Developpeur Senior

“La Belle Vie” livre en 1h dans Paris. Ce n’est pas sans problématique logistique. Pour accompagner au mieux notre équipe gérant la production avec des outils adhoc, principalement autour de la preparation de commande et de l'ecommerce, nous recrutons un développeur senior. Notre stack est faite en Python / Django REST / Reactjs+redux. La mission principale de ce poste est d’apporter les outils nécessaire à la production, mais aussi d'intervenir sur notre api REST ecommerce.  Parler Français couramment est une compétence requise pour ce travail Chez nous * On travaille par itération rapide , une tâche , un ticket, une branche. * Chacun a une responsabilité sur une partie déterminée du code (stats, logistique, ecommerce ….), et est relativement libre des choix sur cette partie (même si il y a relecture). * On est en phase de structuration, si tu aimes “mettre ta pierre à l'édifice”, c’est le bon moment ! * On est une organisation “remote first”. La majorité des gens travaille au moins à 50% en remote. * Dans la mesure du possible, l’équipe tech est “protégée” des interruptions car on considère que la concentration fait gagner en efficacité. * On demande de l’engagement, mais on offre de la flexibilité. Les horaires de travail sont souvent adaptable par exemple selon les contraintes de chacun. Nous cherchons * Quelqu'un qui aime les challenges techniques et fonctionnels * Quelqu'un de curieux et d'autonome. * Quelqu’un qui a plaisir à voir le résultat de son travail, et qui en saisit les enjeux. Les coût de livraisons étant quelques chose de significatif au sein de notre logistique, toute optimisation positive aura un impacte directe. * Quelqu’un qui a déjà au moins 3 ans d’expériences en développement web ou programmation en  général. Les compétences attendus sont * Une capacité à aborder un système complexe. * Des connaissances “de base” : git, sql, un ou plusieurs langages de programmation. * Le monde de containarisation ne t’es pas étranger (ex : docker, docker-compose ...) * Tu es capable de comprendre de la documentation assez théorique de manière aisé. * Idéalement des connaissances en Python et Javascript.  * Tu as de l'experience en SQL pur, ecrire une requete complexe n'est pas un problème pour toi. * Idealement de l’expérience avec Postgresql Télétravail : possible , même à 100% Réduction sur tout nos produits.

items.title: Senior Freelancers
items.content:
Scalable Path

 

Senior Freelancers

At Scalable Path, we work remotely with startups and big businesses to build exciting tech products. Over the past year, we’ve tackled hundreds of cutting-edge projects with clients from all over the world. We place dozens of developers each month, and we’re always looking for more senior-level professionals with expertise in front-end, back-end, design, UI/UX, mobile and DevOps. If you are highly experienced in one of these areas and would like to earn $30 to $70 USD per hour - we want you on our team! Here are the requirements for joining our Scalable Path team: * 5+ years of professional experience * Excellent communication and soft skills * Excellent English skills * A fast, reliable computer and internet connection * Adherence to coding standards and QA best practices. * A positive and collaborative attitude. * An Interest in staying current with the latest industry trends If you’re interested in working with us, please apply now to create a profile.

items.title: MSP
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=4, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=3, nodejs=1, bigdata-ml=8, ruby=4, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=1}
items.content:
New Context Services

 

MSP

New Context is a rapidly growing consulting company in the heart of downtown San Francisco. We specialize in Lean Security: a methodology to consistently apply DevSecOps strategies, leading organizations to build better, safer software through hands-on technical and management consulting. . We are a group of engineers who live and breathe Agile Infrastructure, Systems Automation, Cloud Orchestration, and Information & Application Security. We are seeking a Managed Services Engineer to work remotely as part of a team supporting services for our MSP clients. Support duties include break/fix work, scaling and capacity planning, and participating in a scheduled on-call rotation. Expect to heavily use Open Source software to take on challenges like delivery of highly secured containers, management of IoT devices or supporting Big Data ecosystems at petabyte scale and beyond. You will utilize our core methodologies - Agile, Lean, TDD and Pair Programming - along with your fluency in DevOps - to run robust and reliable systems for our clients.  We foster a tight-knit, highly-supportive environment where there are no stupid questions. Even if you do not know the answer immediately, you'll have the entire company supporting you via Slack, Zoom, or in-person. We also host a daily, all-company stand-up via Zoom, and a weekly company Retro, so you won't just be a name on an email.  At New Context, our core values are Humility, Accountability, Integrity, Empathy, Creativity, Transparency, Quality & Passion! Our employees live these values every single day. Who you are: * Engineer with 2-4 years of IT Experience (Desktop Support, Systems Engineering, Systems Administration); * Comfortable with at least one high-level language, ideally Ruby and/or Python (but could be anything);  * Experienced in Open Source web technologies, especially Docker, Kubernetes, GitLab, and/or the HashiCorp suite; * An excellent communicator, able to deliver project status and explain technical elements to non-technical audiences; * Able to think on your feet and learn quickly on-the-job in order to meet the expectations of our clients; * A great teammate and a creative and independent thinker. Bonus points if you are: * Experienced with in-depth AWS administration; * Experienced and effective working with external clients and customers; * A believer in automated tests and their role in software engineering; * Able to translate complex concepts to business customers Technology we use: We tailor solutions to our customers. You might support any of the following technologies: * Automation: HashiCorp Product Suite (Terraform, Packer, Vault, Consul, Vagrant), Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Salt, Automated Testing * Containerization Ecosystem: Kubernetes, Docker, D2IQ, Nomad, Rancher, CoreOS  * Cloud & Virtualization: AWS, GCP, Azure, OpenStack, Cloudstack, kvm, libvirt * Tools: GitLab, Jenkins, Atlassian Suite, Pivotal Tracker, Git,  * Monitoring: SysDig, Tistlock, Datadog, AppDynamics, New Relic, Sentry, Nagios, Prometheus * Databases/Datastores: Cassandra, Hadoop, Redis, PostgreSQL, MySQL * Security: Compliance Automation, Application Security, Firewalls, OSSEC, AuthN and AuthZ * Languages: Ruby, Python, Go, JavaScript We are committed to equal-employment principles, and we recognize the value of committed employees who feel they are being treated in an equitable and professional manner. We are passionate about finding ways to attract, develop and retain the talent and unique viewpoints needed to meet business objectives, and to recruit and employ highly qualified individuals representing the diverse communities in which we live, because we believe that this diversity results in conversations which stimulate new and innovative ideas. Employment policies and decisions on employment and promotion are based on merit, qualifications, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

items.title: Netzwerk Ingenieur (m/w/d) Karlsruhe or remote ;-) Fluent German required at Ganz & Stock  ...
items.content:
Netzwerk Ingenieur (m/w/d) Karlsruhe or remote ;-) Fluent German required

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Junior, Mid-Level, Senior
Role: DevOps, System Administrator
Industry: IT Recruitment
Company size: 1–10 people
Company type: Private
Company: Ganz & Stock – Karlsruhe, Deutschland

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT+01:00) Berlin +/- 2 hours
Office Location: Karlsruhe, Deutschland. Employees can also work full time from this office.
Relocation Assistance: Yes

Technologies

juniper
enterprise
infrastructure
sysadmin

Job description

Ganz & Stock ist eine Personalberatung, die sich auf den digitalen
Bereich spezialisiert hat.

Unser Kunde, die marbis GmbH mit ihrer Marke „Nitrado“ ist ein weltweit führender Anbieter
im Bereich Gameserver-Hosting. Alle Kernkomponenten sind selbstentwickelt.Die Software,
wird täglich von zehntausenden Nutzern verwendet, sowohl von Endkunden, die privat Dienste
mieten, als auch Business- Partner, zu denen Spieleentwickler unterschiedlichster Größe zählen.

Wir suchen einen Site Netzwerk Ingenieur (m/w/d)

Standort
*Karlsruhe oder remote

ToDo:
*Um die Verantwortung für die Architektur und das Design der Netzwerkinfrastruktur der weltweit  verteilten Rechenzentren.
*Wir benötigen außerdem jemanden, der bei der Kommunikation mit den Rechenzentren helfen kann.  Es geht hauptsächlich um die Kommunikation mit den Remote / Smart Hands Engineers.

Erwartungen:
*Mindestens drei Jahre Berufserfahrung im Netzwerk-Umfeld
*Erfahrung mit Juniper MX Routern, EX/QFX Switches
*Erfahrung im Enterprise Routing, insbesondere „multi homed BGP“ und „IS-IS oder OSPF“

Eine detailliertes Profil der Position und unseres Kunden schicke ich gerne nach.

Wenn Position und Aufgaben zu dir passen, freuen uns auf deine Bewerbung via Stack oder per E-Mail an a.ganz@ganz-stock.de

Alexander Ganz
Geschäftsführender Gesellschafter bei Ganz & Stock

Easy apply

About Ganz & Stock

Flache Hierarchien

Remote Infrastruktur (d.h. auch einige Kollegen arbeiten remote)

Agilität im Unternehmen fest verankert

Langfristige Perspektive (das Unternehmen ist seit über 10 Jahren am Markt, aktuell 30 Mitarbeiter).

Interne Karriere-Optionen, Trainings & Weiterbildung.

Balance : Flexible Arbeitszeiten, Home Office möglich, Obst

Gut mit öffentlichen Verkehrsmitteln zu erreichen (wenn gewünscht)

Benefits

  • Digital Jobs
  • Agile Jobs
  • Varies per client
